This message was automatically generated.
Thanks [~fatkun] for reporting this! Although I think it should be slightly better to make the change the other way, i.e. change the {{Time.now()}} to {{Time.monotonicNow()}} in {{FsVolumeImpl}}.

Hi [~fatkun] great bug report!
Hi [~vagarychen] I thought about it and initially reached the same conclusion as you, but after second thought, DataNode may be restarted between each scan cursor, so Time.monotonicNow may not be appropriate (each JVM process may have different nanoTime origin time).

Would it be possible to make a unit test? Or would someone else like to contribute a test?

[~vagarychen]  nanoTime may reset after machine restart?

[~jojochuang] I will try to write a unit test
lastSavedMs use monotonic time, and not save in file.

[~vagarychen] I have change `lastSavedMs` to `Time.monotonicNow()` and avoid server restart, `lastSavedMs` NOT save in file. I think it's not necessary save in file.

The unit test I move `ctx.datanode.shutdown()` after check cursor file exists, because of datanode shutdown will trigger `saveBlockIterator(iter)`.

[~jojochuang] Any comment?
